Correct Answer (D)

A) Increased unconjugated bilirubin – Very Likely
    •    Massive hemolysis → ↑ heme breakdown → ↑ unconjugated bilirubin (esp. in newborn → kernicterus risk).

(B) Increased fecal urobilinogen – Likely
    •    Hemolysis → ↑ unconjugated bilirubin → converted to urobilinogen in intestine → increased excretion in stool.

(C) Increased stercobilinogen – Likely
    •    Stercobilinogen is another intestinal breakdown product of bilirubin.
    •    Hemolysis → increased bilirubin → increased stercobilin/stercobilinogen in stool (gives dark-colored stool).

D) Hypoalbuminemia – Least likely
    •    Not a direct effect of Rh hemolysis.
    •    Albumin remains normal unless there is severe liver dysfunction or capillary leak, which is not a hallmark of Rh incompatibility.

questions.text: A nulligravida presents to the OPD with uterine prolapse. No cystocele or rectocele were noted. What procedure will you perform?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Abdominal sling surgery

For a nulligravid woman with uterine prolapse and no cystocele or rectocele, we will perform an abdominal sling surgery.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an indication of early cord clamping?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Delayed cord clamping means clamping the umbilical cord ≥ 1-3 minutes of birth. The advantage of this is that 80 ml of blood (approximately 50 mg of elemental iron) in the cord goes to the newborn, preventing neonatal anaemia.

questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents with a history of low-grade fever and cough. Based on the provided Chest X-ray image, what is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Miliary mottling refers to opacities that resemble millet seeds and are seen in the above Chest X-ray, which are seen in miliary TB (not specific). It can also be seen in metastasis, pulmonary hemosiderosis, or silicosis.

questions.text: Which of the following images is most likely a case of acoustic schwannomas?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

An enhancing mass in the cerebellopontine angle with extension into the internal acoustic meatus is typical of an acoustic schwannoma.

questions.text: A 25 year old woman presents with recurrent pregnancy loss. She has had three first-trimester miscarriages over the past two years. Her menstrual cycles are regular, and she has no significant past medical history. On physical examination, no abnormalities are noted. A pelvic ultrasound reveals a uterine anomaly. Which of the following is most likely associated with her recurrent pregnancy loss?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

This patient’s recurrent miscarriages with a uterine anomaly are most likely to be Septate uterus because of its septum. Septate uterus is associated with recurrent first-trimester miscarriages, Infertility. D/D: Bicornuate uterus has an intercomual angle >105 degrees during hysterosalpingography.

questions.text: Which of the following milestones would you generally expect a 3 year old child to display?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Spoon handling

The ability to handle a spoon well and feed self is usually developed by 24 months (2 years) and would be expected in a 3 year old child.

questions.text: A 40-year-old female patient complains of a persistent headache. A CT scan of the head was performed, as shown below. What is the most accurate diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The given image of the NCCT head shows a star of death appearance, which is a characteristic feature of subarachnoid hemorrhage.

questions.text: A 28 year old woman, G2 P1 L1 at 38 weeks gestation is seen in early labor. She has a history of cesarean section done 3 years ago for breech presentation. The obstetrician decides on a cesarean section. Which of the following is NOT an indication for a cesarean section in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Gestational diabetes that is well-controlled with diet and exercise alone is not an indication for a C-section. Women with GDM can often have a vaginal delivery if there are no other complications. If controlled, there is no significant risk to the mother or fetus.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a symptom of severe dehydration?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Thirsty child

A thirsty child signifies some dehydration, not severe dehydration.

questions.text: A G3P2 patient with preeclampsia develops seizures and is started on the Pritchard regimen. What level of serum magnesium should be maintained in this patient in order to prevent seizures?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

4-7 meq/L

The clinical picture is suggestive of eclampsia and to control fits, optimum serum magnesium levels of 4-7 mEq/L have to be maintained.

questions.text: In a 4-month old, term infant with open posterior fontanelle and hypotonia, you suspect congenital hypothyroidism and send thyroid studies. Which of the following is the most common cause of this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Thyroid dysgenesis

Thyroid dysgenesis is the most common cause of permanent congenital hypothyroidism (80-85% of cases) > dyshormonogenesis (15%).

questions.text: A four-year-old child has an upper arm circumference of 105 mm. On giving a trial of therapeutic food, the child accepted the feeds well. There is no edema seen on examination. What will be the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Uncomplicated SAM

In the given clinical scenario, child with an upper arm circumference of 105 mm who responds well to the trial of therapeutic food, indicating good appetite, is diagnosed with uncomplicated SAM.

questions.text: Identify the CTG pattern shown in the given image.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Early deceleration

The given CTG shows early decelerations. It is seen in fetal head compression. In early decelerations, the onset, nadir, and recovery of deceleration coincide with the beginning, peak, and ending of uterine contraction respectively.

questions.text: A 34 year old lady is concerned about her upcoming myomectomy operation. Which of the following is not a complication of this operation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Infertility is not a complication of myomectomy. Myomectomy is performed to preserve fertility and remove fibroid from the uterus.

questions.text: A newborn is being assessed at 5 minutes after birth. He is found to have a heart rate of 110bpm, coughs on stimulation, and has a strong cry. His limbs are well flexed, the body is pink, but extremities appear blue. The Apgar score for this newborn is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)           

The Apgar score for this newborn is 9.

In this baby:

Body pink, extremities blue: score 1

Heart rate, >100 beats/min: score 2

Coughs on stimulation, score 2

Well flexed of the extremities: score 2

Strong cry: score 2

Thus the total score is 9.

questions.text: A lady who is 24 weeks pregnant came to the OPD for routine antenatal check up. She has a history of normal twin delivery 3 years back and 2 abortions. What is is her obstetric score?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

In this case scenario 
G (gravida)- present pregnancy + twin pregnancy + 2 abortions = 4 
P (parity)- twin pregnancy =1 
A (abortion)- 2 abortions = 2 
L (living)- twins = 2

questions.text: Which of the following is the pathological heart sound seen during pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Diastolic Murmur

Diastolic murmur is considered to be a pathological change in pregnancy. It is the ejection systolic murmur which is a physiological change.

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents with difficulty urinating and a history of profuse, creamy urethral discharge. He reports a prior untreated sexually transmitted infection. The urethrogram of the patient is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Bulbar urethral stricture

The patient's symptoms of difficulty urinating and a history of profuse, creamy urethral discharge strongly suggest a gonococcal infection, which can lead to inflammation and scarring in the bulbar urethra, resulting in a stricture. The urethrogram findings of narrowing specifically in the bulbar urethra support this diagnosis.

questions.text: Select the incorrect laboratory findings associated with PCOS:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A fasting glucose:insulin ratio of <4.5 is seen in polycystic ovarian syndrome

questions.text: What could be the potential diagnosis for a 6-year-old child who exhibits hepatosplenomegaly, generalized lymphadenopathy, fever, and develops a rash following the administration of ampicillin?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The patient’s presentation with hepatosplenomegaly, generalized lymphadenopathy, fever, and a rash following the administration of ampicillin is suggestive of infectious mononucleosis.

choices.text: Beta HCG - Maintains corpus luteum function
Human Placental Lactogen - Helps in maternal adaptation to fetal energy requirements.

questions.text: Which of the following pairs of placental hormones and their function is incorrectly matched?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Activin is a hormone secreted by the placenta and ovaries. It regulates placental GnRH synthesis but not beta HCG. Beta HCG synthesis regulation is done by Inhibin.

questions.text: Which of the following is not assessed by measuring MUAC (Middle upper arm circumference?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

MUAC does not assess dehydration. it primarily evaluates body fat reserves, nutritional status, and growth monitoring.

questions.text: 32-year-old woman undergoing evaluation for infertility has an endometrial biopsy. Histopathology shows the following features. What is the most likely phase of the menstrual cycle?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: 32 year old woman with pain lower abdomen for last few weeks undergoes laparoscopy, the following image is seen what is likely diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: A 32-year-old G2P1 woman at 34 weeks gestation presents with a fundal height of 40 cm. Ultrasound confirms polyhydramnios with an amniotic fluid index (AFI) of 30 cm. The patient reports feeling short of breath and uncomfortable. Which of the following is NOT a common complication in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Hydrops fetalis 
An AFI of 30 cm suggests Polyhydramnios and although it can sometimes be associated with hydrops, it is not a common complication of polyhydramnios. Hydrops is a separate condition involving abnormal fetal fluid accumulation and is not directly caused by polyhydramnios.

questions.text: A patient presents to the OPD as a known case of cervical cancer. On further evaluation, the pelvic sidewall was found to be involved, and hydronephrosis was also seen. Identify the stage of cancer.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Stage 3B 
This stage is characterized by the involvement of the pelvic sidewall and/or hydronephrosis (or a non-functioning kidney) caused by the tumor. Both the pelvic sidewall involvement and hydronephrosis are key features.

choices.text: Male sexual partners to be treated at the same time

questions.text: A 25-year-old female presents with complaints of a sudden, profuse, and offensive vaginal discharge. On examination, her vulva is inflamed and her vaginal walls are red and inflamed with small, punctate, hemorrhagic spots as shown in the image. Which of the following statements is true in this scenario?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The presence of motile, pear-shaped flagellated trichomonas on wet mount microscopy is a characteristic feature of Trichomonas vaginalis. Trichomoniasis is a sexually transmitted infection, so the patient's sexual partner should also be treated.

questions.text: What is the most appropriate diagnosis for a 3-month-old child presenting with cold, cough, and rapid breathing (RR 58/min) but no chest indrawing or danger signs according to IMNCI?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Pneumonia

The clinical presentation of a 3-month-old child with rapid breathing, cold, and cough suggests pneumonia. However, since there are no signs of chest indrawing or other danger signs, it cannot be classified as severe pneumonia.

questions.text: A 38-year old lady in her 6th week of gestation is concerned about Down’s syndrome and enquires about noninvasive prenatal testing. When is the earliest that the test can be undertaken?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

9 weeks

Non-Invasive Prenatal Testing (NIPT) can be done any time after 9-10 weeks, after which it is not dependent on the gestational age.

choices.text: Delayed clamping, cutting and ligation of cord

questions.text: Which of the following is not included in the active management of the third stage of labor to prevent postpartum hemorrhage?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Gentle massage of uterus

As per the latest guidelines, uterine massage is no longer a core component of Active Management of the Third Stage of Labor (AMTSL) that is performed for the prevention of postpartum hemorrhage (PPH).

choices.text: 4 mg daily from 1 month before conception to 12 weeks of pregnancy
1 mg daily with iron and a nutritious diet

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman, who had a previous pregnancy complicated by a neural tube defect in her infant, is planning another pregnancy. What is the appropriate prophylactic folic acid regimen for her?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Folic acid supplementation with 4 mg daily from 1 month before pregnancy to 12 weeks of pregnancy is crucial for preventing neural tube defects in prior affected females. Women with a history of infant NTDs should adhere to the higher dosage regimen to optimize their chances of a healthy pregnancy and birth outcome.
